author: Tara Ferri
comment: It would be a great tool if the times were right. I'm on the platform, the app says the J is pulling in and the M is 4 min away. The board says 12 min for the J and the M isn't even on the board. I can see 4 stops away since we're above ground and there's no train in sight. So this app is basically useless.

reply.author: Transit App, Inc.
reply.content: Hi Tara, right now, we use the MTA’s official real-time time feed for developers. But, you’re not the first to report these differences between the real-time feed and the live arrivals in stations. MTA is aware of the issue and we are awaiting a fix from them - we want to make sure we're showing accurate subway arrivals!

author: Jennifer F
comment: The app was so good. Was.. Whatever you did on the most recent update broke live bus timers because my connection on other apps is totally stable and this one keeps jumping in and out of live mode so I never get accurate times. Dont know if this is a Toronto issue or an app wide thing. Either way the app no longer functions for the purpose I downloaded it for.

author: Krissy Gianforte
comment: I use this app for my daily commute. Since I have saved my work and home locations, it's one click to "go" and I get alerts! A notification two stops before my stop, and another at my stop. I haven't missed my stop yet! What more do you need

author: Jam K
comment: Update: They have dropped the Android Wear app altogether in the newer builds (you can still install it through an old build, if you can obtain one), so had to take a star off the rating, as that was a vital part of personal use of this application.  Previous Review: Great app. Use it mostly on Android Wear. Always have to launch it, close and relaunch it on personal AW watches to get it to properly locate position (that is why this is a 4 star review).  If this issue could be resolved, this is a five star application.

reply.author: Transit App, Inc.
reply.content: Hi Jam, we're glad you like the app! If you're still having problems loading your location on your AW can you send us an email through the app so we can have a chance to look at the issue?

comment: I'm in Montreal and a new user to public transit because of this app. Works like a charm every time! Easy, friendly, accurate, and beautiful visuals. The only thing I would add is a simple option to choose which bus stop to depart from. Sometimes it defaults to a further stop depending on the setting "minimize walking". Other than that it is pretty much perfect. As a data person I would love to work for this company!

author: Laura Carmer
comment: I love this app! I love that I can get delay notifications and real time updates. It's awesome that I can track the bus or train by seconds. Loved the update that added the ability to order an Uber from the app. This app has truly everything I need, the only reason I gave it 4 stars is because there is no way to save data or share it on another device. I've had to restore all my locations and notifications again because I switched devices.

author: Flynn
comment: The destination times used to be perfect but now they seem like random numbers. It doesn't use the live bus tracker that TransLink gives out to everyone. If this problem is fixed I'll gladly rate 5 stars but right now it fails at its most basic task

author: orion mok
comment: This app has a lot of potential, having pretty much all possible transportation services included in one app with detailed fare estimations and time of arrival. However, I mainly use this app to check the bus schedule here in Montreal and it is pretty bad at it in my opinion. First of all, you can't save a specific direction of bus or even save a stop to quickly check the arrival times. Second is that when I don't know what stop I am going to be at, the map showing the bus route is pretty troublesome to navigate through. This app has a lot going for it, but if it fails at doing the most basic thing of giving bus schedules, then as soon as another real time bus schedule is available, I will jump and go try that one instead.

reply.author: Transit App, Inc.
reply.content: Hi Orion, sorry to hear that you've been finding our app difficult to navigate. Transit works based on your location to automatically show you nearby lines without having to search, which is why we don't have the option to save specific stops at the moment. Feel free to share any extra feedback in an email if you'd like to chat more!

author: Genevieve Gilmore
comment: Was wrong! Missed the whole section between Hornsby and Woy Woy - had it as only 4 mins - lucky I checked all the stops!

author: Inderbir Kaur
comment: App doesn't show the stop number from where to pick bus. Sometimes in area of 100 m there can be two different pick up points & that two on opposite sides, which is difficult for a newcomer to get.

author: veraliz cornett
comment: Whenever I take the bus this app frequently changes the times the buses are coming and notifies me to get off the bus at the wrong stop. It makes me late by giving me false time schedules and by not notifying me when buses are late. I don't kniw if its just my app but it's really starting to bug me.
This app's great for knowing what's coming, but I haven't been able to figure out how to see schedules for other days. I keep the SEPTA app for that.

author: Heather Fitzgerald
comment: Even if I had to pay for this app I would!! It's fantastic! It's easy to use and understand. You can also look for when you have to leave to catch your bus by what time you need to be somewhere! (Wonderful for doctor appointments!)

author: eric lai
comment: Transit really does its best to keep up with the slow mta system

author: Seokster L
comment: undoubtedly one of the best apps to use in canadian cities

author: Logan Hernandez
comment: Searches for location and never stops. I'm in Sacramento, California and need an offline transit app but all others either are not offline or don't cover Sacramento.

reply.author: Transit App, Inc.
reply.content: Hi Logan, what city are you in? I'd love to have a closer look to see if you're in an unsupported region or if something else is up!

author: Fernando Nerio Jr.
comment: This real time is scum, the bus is always in the wrong time

author: roland jousset
comment: Works well at times the location is wrong

reply.author: Transit App, Inc.
reply.content: Hi Roland! When you say the location is wrong what do you mean? Are you seeing a blue or purple dot to represent your location the map?

author: Jonathan Focil
comment: Been using it for a while. The times are fairly reliable. I love using GO and feel like I'm contributing just a little bit to help others.

author: Coe Kane
comment: So I've been waiting here for 15 minutes. Bus was supposed to be here -6 minutes ago. Your guy's app sucks

author: Brenden Resnick
comment: Awesome app. Just switched from iOS, still amazing here. Gets your wherever you need.

author: Eric Kaiser
comment: This app appears to know what is going on better than octranspo does

author: gabriela jimenez
comment: great app! very useful, i use it every day to plan my route

author: Rob Findlay
comment: Why do you not show vehicle location?

author: Johnny Gates
comment: Easier access to the live time bus locator
Very accurate, very helpful.

author: Samo Tune
comment: Perfect

author: Jesse Sarabia
comment: Nice

author: Blake Volkan
comment: Better then google maps!  Ive tested it in newyorkcity and longisland ny. %98 accurately shown. Also anywhere i point dot it shows me thar areas bus train etc. With this app i can go on a vacation using public transportation. So far cannot say nothing wrong but its been very very helpfull. Better then nyc trasit app

author: Benjamin Cool-Fergus
comment: Essential app for straphangers! It makes getting around on transit a breeze. Real-time departures, automatic rerouting if you miss a connection, audio reminders for when to leave/get off... It's everything I need and even some things I didn't realize I wanted. It can be a bit of a data hog, but that may be because I always have it open since it's such a joy to use.

Lots of bugs with every release. New bugs pop up all the time. Makes me want to uninstall. In the latest version, some bus lines show every single arrival on the main page taking up too much space. Times are not that accurate either. Sometimes the app doesn't refresh arrival times on first lookup. But it does provide routes and transportation based on location. Overall so so

author: Mathew Pinard
comment: Works well most of the time. One nice to have feature would be to integrate Transit with Google Assistant requests. There's that new "Routine" feature that came out which you can initiate a batch of events through a single command.  If I could say "hey Google, I'm done working", I'd like to have one of these actions to be Transit that launches the optimal bus route to go home from my position in Go mode, and provide realtime location data to other users around me who uses the same bus route.

reply.author: Transit App, Inc.
reply.content: Hi Mathew, that's on our to do list so stay tuned!

author: Gururaja SR
comment: I've taken the hint. So given 4 stars. Seriously speaking, an indispensable app for people like me who would prefer public transport. However it isn't just the app, but the on ground service has some distance to travel, that too rather quickly, to earn one more that's five stars. Love you folks.

author: Kevin Michael
comment: The App hardly ever provides accurate train arrivals.  The Map is glitchy.  Might as well just use the countdown clocks that have been installed in all the subway stations...alot more accurate and safer sincs you dont have to have your phone in plain sight for a mugger to steal it.

author: Angie H
comment: lol why does this app work better on my itouch 5th gen, and its 7 years old. Tired of it saying i dont have location services on when i do. Always screwing up departure times so im looking for a another app and dumping this one.

author: John Drane
comment: Best transit app hands down! I've used it in over 60 cities in North America/Europe/Australia and it's like magic getting around in a foreign place. Plus they are always correcting wrong information from local agencies to make life better..10 stars.

author: Gabriel Lopez
comment: This app has issues syncing or keeps flitting between arrival times. It struggles pin pointing actual location. I have rated this app highly in the past but there's no reason for it to be declining.

reply.author: Transit App, Inc.
reply.content: Hi Gabriel, I'm sorry the app is having trouble with your location. When it's not locating you correctly, are you seeing a blue or purple dot? What happens when you tap on the compass pin in the bottom right hand corner of the map on the main screen of the app?

author: Samuel Fauteux
comment: Trying to provide transit data to GO is extremely unpleasant. The app is a good idea, however it crashes and the information it offers is too unstable to be reliable.   There needs to be a "I'm currently on this bus" option.   When the app crashes, bugs or desynchronizizes with the actual bus departure it's very frustrating to tell it I'm ALREADY on the bus to get your notifications back and provide crowdsourcing data to other passengers.   Will give 5 stars eventually but it's hardly a polished product.

reply.author: Transit App, Inc.
reply.content: Hi Samuel, I'm sorry that you're finding GO glitchy. We're still tweaking the motion controls for GO which will help with the desynchronizig. When you're already on a bus, do you start go by tapping the GO button under the route you're on?

author: Patricia Arnedo
comment: DO NOT TRUST. This app is super frustrating. Sometimes it is accurate, and sometimes it switches uptown and downtown train arrival times. This has caused a lot of confusion and frustration, especially when you think your train will arrive in 2 minutes but it was actually giving you times for the same line in the opposite direction. Seems like a huge flaw that should not have escaped testing stages.

author: John A. Pettis
comment: After latest update, I get notification that my Location is turned off when I'm using the Battery Saving Location setting. This never happened before. App still seems to know my location - puzzling.

reply.author: Transit App, Inc.
reply.content: Hi John! The banner thats showing location services disabled is a bug that we are experiencing in the app at the moment. We fixed the issue and it will be fixed in the next version of the app coming out in the next few weeks so keep your eyes out for that!
